trans-unit.source: Accessing a read-only database in a zip/jar file

seg-source.mrk: Accessing a read-only database in a zip/jar file

target.mrk: Accessing a read-only database in a zip/jar file

trans-unit.source: To access a database in a zip/jar, you specify the jar in the subsubprotocol.

seg-source.mrk: To access a database in a zip/jar, you specify the jar in the subsubprotocol.

target.mrk: To access a database in a zip/jar, you specify the jar in the subsubprotocol.

trans-unit.source: The pathToArchive is the absolute path to the archive file. The databasePathWithinArchive is the relative path to the database within the archive. For example:

seg-source.mrk: The pathToArchive is the absolute path to the archive file.
The databasePathWithinArchive is the relative path to the database within the archive.

target.mrk: The pathToArchive is the absolute path to the archive file.
The databasePathWithinArchive is the relative path to the database within the archive.

trans-unit.source: If you have trouble finding a database within an archive, check the contents of the archive using your archive tool. The databasePathWithinArchive must match the one in the archive. You might find that the path in the archive has a leading slash, and thus the URL would be:

seg-source.mrk: If you have trouble finding a database within an archive, check the contents of the archive using your archive tool.
The databasePathWithinArchive must match the one in the archive.
You might find that the path in the archive has a leading slash, and thus the URL would be:

target.mrk: If you have trouble finding a database within an archive, check the contents of the archive using your archive tool.
The databasePathWithinArchive must match the one in the archive.
You might find that the path in the archive has a leading slash, and thus the URL would be:

trans-unit.source: Databases in a jar or zip file are always opened read-only and there is currently no support to allow updates of any type.

seg-source.mrk: Databases in a jar or zip file are always opened read-only and there is currently no support to allow updates of any type.

target.mrk: Databases in a jar or zip file are always opened read-only and there is currently no support to allow updates of any type.
